title: Is the Sun's gravitational pull greater than the Earth's gravitational pull? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you compare the force of gravity between the earth and a person on the surface of earth to the force of gravity between the sun and a person on a surface of earth then the earth’s force of gravity is stronger. (this is why we don’t float up towards the sun, yet the earth still orbits it). If you compare the force of gravity between the earth and the moon to the force of gravity between the sun and Alpha Centauri (the suns nearest stellar neighbor around 4.4 light years away) then the sun’s force of gravity is greater. Ultimately the force of gravity depends on the distance between two object’s individual centers of mass and the mass of each object you’re comparing the force of gravity between. The equation for this is Newton’s Gravitaion Equation.
